page.title: 16Children's Leisure Pursuits
page.content: Most children have{television}in their homes and watch it for at least 7 hours per week. Some children prefer to read, cook, sew or play a{musical {instrument}such as piano, guitar, recorder or violin. Indoors they may play board games, spend time drawing and colouring or making models. Many have home{micro-computers}and use them to play arcade-type games. Out of doors the most popular games are{skipping}for girls and{football for boys. Many ride{bicycles}or play on swings or climbing frames, perhaps at a recreation ground. About a third go to{classes}for gymnastics, ballet, disco dancing or judo. A few go horse-riding. Up to the age of about 10 years most children play in or near the home. As they get older they tend to become more venturesome.
